body: Half of the time you answer the captcha, it bugs out and doesn't save your progress, leading the same captcha. This time I had to solve it four times in a row to access ruqqus. This is especially annoying since it spends 1-2 minutes loading before and after the captcha check. This was not occurring before a few days ago. I also at random times have to re-do this verification after I've already been in (and haven't closed the browser). I'll go to reply to a comment or something, and it'll suddenly give an error, and reloading the page reveals that I need to complete the captcha again.
body_html: Half of the time you answer the captcha, it bugs out and doesn't save your progress, leading the same captcha. This time I had to solve it four times in a row to access ruqqus. This is especially annoying since it spends 1-2 minutes loading before and after the captcha check. This was not occurring before a few days ago. I also at random times have to re-do this verification after I've already been in (and haven't closed the browser). I'll go to reply to a comment or something, and it'll suddenly give an error, and reloading the page reveals that I need to complete the captcha again.

body: They're actually not, although they take things way too literally under "don't promote violence" that's probably because they're a small site that could easily face legal trouble if even one person whines about a post not being actioned "correctly" according to the TOS. And they also face tons of DDOS attacks probably from Voat and AHS whiners, so they don't really have a choice in whether to use cloudflare or some other kind of protection.
body_html: They're actually not, although they take things way too literally under "don't promote violence" that's probably because they're a small site that could easily face legal trouble if even one person whines about a post not being actioned "correctly" according to the TOS. And they also face tons of DDOS attacks probably from Voat and AHS whiners, so they don't really have a choice in whether to use cloudflare or some other kind of protection.

For example "Which picture shows a feeling of dread" and then make users choose.

post.title: Ruqqus's cloudflare captcha system is broken

body: Saidit have used the DDOS protection from Cloudfare to block my IP twice just for telling someone that attacked my post history to KYS.

parent.body: I think the admins recognize this, but cloudflare offers free DDoS protection, there's no issue as long as contingency measures are in place.
parent.body_html: I think the admins recognize this, but cloudflare offers free DDoS protection, there's no issue as long as contingency measures are in place.

post.body: Half of the time you answer the captcha, it bugs out and doesn't save your progress, leading the same captcha. This time I had to solve it four times in a row to access ruqqus. This is especially annoying since it spends 1-2 minutes loading before and after the captcha check. This was not occurring before a few days ago. I also at random times have to re-do this verification after I've already been in (and haven't closed the browser). I'll go to reply to a comment or something, and it'll suddenly give an error, and reloading the page reveals that I need to complete the captcha again.

I also at random times have to re-do this verification after I've already been in (and haven't closed the browser).
